snp3.8:1.1: A _nimitta_ is a sign or portent, and is commonly used in the context of omens, prophecy, or fortune-telling. Here it means that there is no portent or omen by which one can predict the extent of life.
snp3.8:17.4: The commentary says this means, “I cannot bring back the dead”, which is followed by Norman and Bodhi. But I think the text elides a second negative and should read: _na eso alabbhā_, literally “This is not not-to-be-gotten by me”, i.e. “I cannot escape this”.
